inscription:
14 pairs of the poems about insects:
Suzumushi (\"bell-ringing\" cricket) and mtsumushi (matsumushi cricket) ; ari (ant) and gejigeji (house centipede); koorogi (cricket) and hachi (bee) ; kamikirimushi (longhorn) and mimizu (earthworm); imomushi (caterpillar) and cho_ (butterfly); mukade (centipede) and hyakutorimushi (looper); nomi (flea) and shirami (louse); ? and minomushi (bagworm); kamakiri (mantis) and ashimatoi(wireworm); hae (fly) and ka (mosquito); higurashi (tanna)and kogamemushi (goldbug) ; kuchinawa (snake) and gamagaeru (toad); kumo (spider) and semi(cicada); kemushi (caterpillar) and kutsuwamushi (mecopoda)
markings: Kiyomasu seal in the last page
title: The Insect Scroll
